list.title: module:Config.SecureConfig
list.description: A secure configuration. This uses an underlying IConfig for storage. Multiple secure configs can be placed within the same IConfig so long as different id is set. By default pbkdf2 is used to generate NaCl keys. If argon is provided then argon2 will be used to generate the NaCl keys. Applications should use argon2.

list.title: module:Config.SecureConfig.isInitialized
list.description: Checks if the secure config has initialized with a password or key

list.title: module:Config.SecureConfig.isLocked
list.description: Checks if the secure config is locked. If not locked the secure config can be used without blocking waiting for user to unlock.

list.title: module:Config.SecureConfig.lock
list.description: Locks the secure config

list.title: module:Config.SecureConfig.setIdentity
list.description: Initialize the secure config with a key

list.title: module:Config.SecureConfig.setPassword
list.description: Initialize the secure config with a password

list.title: module:Config.SecureConfig.start
list.description: Start the secure storage

list.title: module:Config.SecureConfig.unlock
list.description: Unlocks the secure config

list.title: module:Config.SecureConfig.waitForUnlocked
list.description: Wait for config to be unlocked

list.title: module:Config.SecureConfig#event:blocked
list.description: An read/write operation has been blocked due to the secure config being locked.

list.title: module:Config.SecureConfig#event:intialized
list.description: The secure config has been successfully initialized with a passowrd or key.

list.title: module:Config.SecureConfig#event:locked
list.description: The secure config has been locked

list.title: module:Config.SecureConfig#event:ready
list.description: Ready event. The secure config is ready to be unlocked and have configuration values read or written.

list.title: module:Config.SecureConfig#event:setup-required
list.description: Setup required event. The secure config has not yet has a password or key configured.

list.title: module:Config.SecureConfig#event:unlocked
list.description: The secure config has been unlocked

list.title: module:Db.ISchema.permissions
list.description: Collection level read/new/change permissions

list.title: module:Db.LokiDb
list.description:
A db implementation based on LokiJS.

Ideal for frontend apps with small datasets (smaller than total RAM). This is an in-memory db so it trades RAM efficiency for access speed.

list.title: module:Db.TingoDb
list.description: Ideal for extremely large datasets with frequent document additions. Has a very efficient append-only file system driver which is ideal for embedded platforms. All database indexes must fit into RAM and are re-computed at db load time.

list.title: module:Db.ZangoDb
list.description: Ideal for frontend apps with large datasets (larger then total RAM). This is an IndexedDb based driver so it span to nearly 1/3 of total system storage spave available to the browser/app.

list.title: module:Party.DocumentFactory
list.description: Represents document schemas mapped to contructor claasses which extend IDocument

list.title: module:Party.IDocument
list.description: Represents a document with caching and local+remote change notifications

list.title: module:Party.IDocument.cleanData
list.description: document data with no library added fields

list.title: module:Party.IDocument.data
list.description: entire document

list.title: module:Party.IDocument.hash
list.description: hash of document.data using sha256

list.title: module:Party.IDocument.id
list.description: Document mongo-id

list.title: module:Party.IDocument.idObj
list.description: Document id object

list.title: module:Party.IDocument.idString
list.description: Document id string in format <type>:<mongo-id>

list.title: module:Party.IDocument.revision
list.description: Document revision string

list.title: module:Party.IDocument.type
list.description: Document type string

list.title: module:Party.IDocument.unwatch
list.description: Stop watching for remote document changes

list.title: module:Party.IDocument.watchField
list.description: Watch a field for changes. If value is supplied watches for field and value to match.

list.title: module:Party.IDocument#event:change
list.description: Document change Event - This is event is triggered when a document has been modified on the remote service

list.title: module:Party.IDocument#event:create
list.description: Document create Event - This event is triggered after a document has been created and applied to the backing cache of Document.data. If Document.followcache is true the document doc has also accepted the change.

list.title: module:Party.IDocument#event:field
list.description: Field change event. This is emitted as field.[FIELD_PATH]

list.title: module:Party.IDocument#event:remove
list.description: Document remove Event - This event is triggered after a document has been removed and applied to the backing cache of Document.data. If Document.followcache is true the document doc has also accepted the change.

list.title: module:Party.IDocument#event:update
list.description: Document update Event - This event is triggered after a change has been applied to the backing cache of Document.data. If Document.followcache is true the document doc has also accepted the change.

list.title: module:Party.IDocument#event:value
list.description: Document value Event - This event is triggered after a change has been applied to the backing cache of Document.data. Only fired when Document.followcache is true.

list.title: module:Party.IParty.find
list.description: Starts a query

list.title: module:Party.LokiParty
list.description:
A local party based on LokiJS.

Works great for front end. Doesn't scale well for centralized server use and does not have efficient file system representation for many embedded applications. Overall this driver is RAM bound holds the entire DB in memory. When running on filesystems this driver re-writes the entire collection during save operations.

list.title: module:Party.MongoParty
list.description:
A party implementation based on Mongodb and mongoose.

The humongouse database we all know all love. If you need a multi-region HA database, this is the one.

list.title: module:Party.Query.all
list.description: matches a list that is a superset of given list

list.title: module:Party.Query.and
list.description: following path segments will be anded (default behavior)

list.title: module:Party.Query.contains
list.description: Check if field contains value

list.title: module:Party.Query.dna
list.description: Closes scope of most recent and

list.title: module:Party.Query.elem
list.description: list operators -> subtype of match tree nodes -> most recent .where('param') path must be list for these to match searches for a single element of list matching all following conditions between elem .. mele nodes where('path') calls are relative to param path scope at opening of element match

list.title: module:Party.Query.equals
list.description: Check if field equals value

list.title: module:Party.Query.exec
list.description: return a promise resolving to result of query

list.title: module:Party.Query.exists
list.description: Check if field exists

list.title: module:Party.Query.gt
list.description: Check if field is greater than value

list.title: module:Party.Query.id
list.description: query for single msg by given id prereq -> type (not types) all other query ops (except type) will be ignored

list.title: module:Party.Query.ids
list.description: query for a list of msgs by given ids prereq -> type (not types) all other query ops (except type) will be ignored

list.title: module:Party.Query.in
list.description: Check if field is in list of values

list.title: module:Party.Query.limit
list.description: limit # of msgs returned by query to a maximum of count

list.title: module:Party.Query.lt
list.description: Check if field is less than value

list.title: module:Party.Query.mele
list.description: Close elem function stack

list.title: module:Party.Query.or
list.description: The following path segments will be or'ed

list.title: module:Party.Query.owner
list.description: restrict query to msgs with owner matching given type, id pair

list.title: module:Party.Query.regex
list.description: Check if field is matched by regex

list.title: module:Party.Query.ro
list.description: Close scope of most recent or

list.title: module:Party.Query.seelct
list.description: filter fields from parameters of returned msgs

list.title: module:Party.Query.size
list.description: matches list with exactly count items

list.title: module:Party.Query.sort
list.description: sort returned msgs on given param path (leading '-' reverses sort)

list.title: module:Party.Query.type
list.description: restrict query to msgs of given type

list.title: module:Party.Query.types
list.description: restrict query to msgs of given types not compatible with type

list.title: module:Party.Query.where
list.description: sets context for following operations to given param path

list.title: module:Party.TingoParty
list.description: A local party implementation based on TingoDB Ideal for extremely large datasets with frequent document additions. Has a very efficient append-only file system driver which is ideal for embedded platforms. All database indexes must fit into RAM and are re-computed at db load time.

list.title: module:Party.ZangoParty
list.description:
A local party implementation based on IndexedDb via ZangoDB

Ideal for frontend apps with large datasets (larger then total RAM). This is an IndexedDb based driver so it span to nearly 1/3 of total system storage spave available to the browser/app.

list.description: Key used to encrypt content. This may be an ephermal key or a long lived key.

list.description: Type of middleware. Allowed values are pre or post

list.title: module:Service.IService
list.description: A service with schema, documents, endpoints, middleware and tasks. Provide either paths to source files for compilation or provided a pre-built service to import.

list.description: Add a document class implementation to the service

list.title: module:Service.IService.addEndpoint
list.description: Add a dataparty endpoint to the service by pather

list.title: module:Service.IService.addEndpoint
list.description: Add a middleware to this service

list.title: module:Service.IService.addSchema
list.description: Add a dataparty schema implementation to the service

list.title: module:Service.IService.addTask
list.description: Add a tasker task implementation to the service

list.title: module:Service.IService.compile
list.description: Compile a service. This will build two output files, one for host usage -service.json and another for client usage -schema.json.

list.title: module:Service.IService.importBuild
list.description: Import a pre-build service

list.title: module:Service.ITask
list.description: Interface class for supporting tasker tasks in dataparty. To add a task to dataparty service extend this class and implement the Name, Description and Config members.

list.title: module:Service.ITask.info
list.description: Returns the task's Name, Description, and Config

list.title: module:Service.RouterRunner.onRequest
list.description: Expressjs style way of calling an endpoint. The req will be passed to the router to select the appropritate endpoint

list.title: module:Service.RunnerRouter
list.description: A multi-domain drop in replacement for anywhere we use origin-router.Router. By creating multiple dataparty ServiceRunners you can manage multiple parties and multiple services and merge them into either a single combined service. Or host them as multiple seperate domains. Essentially, this allows the ServiceHost to be multi-tenant.

list.title: module:Service.ServiceHost.apiApp
list.description: Express app

list.title: module:Service.ServiceHost.router
list.description: The router

list.title: module:Service.ServiceHost.runner
list.description: Dataparty service runner

list.title: module:Service.ServiceHost.start
list.description: Start hosting services

list.title: module:Service.ServiceHost.stop
list.description: Stop hosting services

list.title: module:Service.ServiceRunner
list.description: Sandboxed service runner. This runner uses the vm2 package to run end points in a fully isolated context. Endpoints, pre-middleware and post-middleware all run as independant precompiled VMScripts.

list.title: module:Service.ServiceRunner.onRequest
list.description: Expressjs style way of calling an endpoint. The req will be passed to the router to select the appropritate endpoint

list.title: module:Service.ServiceRunnerNode
list.description: Unsafe service runner. This service runner uses eval to run services, endpoints and tasks. This provides only simple context seperation and does not do effective context isolation. This should only be used where the service is knwon trustworthy. When the useNative option is set to true the service will run in the same context as this class with no isolation at all.

list.title: module:Service.ServiceRunnerNode.onRequest
list.description: Expressjs style way of calling an endpoint. The req will be passed to the router to select the appropritate endpoint

list.title: module:Topics.LocalTopicHost
list.description: Implementation of ROS style pub/sub topics. This runs on a single thread/peer and can be shared to other peers. However, this is a centralized implementation. So if the hosting node stops all topic traffic will halt as well.
